item.title: Quality Firemaking base
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

thomas, I really don’t think he gets what you are trying to say…

strucker, when working with incoming packets (dropping an item, wearing an item, using an item on an item, item on an object, walking, etc) YOU NEVER TRUST THE DATA BEING SENT

int objectId = in.readByte(...); int itemUsedOnObject = in.readShort(...); int slot = in.readInt(...);

you see the data above? DO NOT TRUST ANY OF IT

and do you know why? because people can use things like cheat engine and wpe to inject false packets. so say you didn’t have any sort of check and we had this code.

[code=java]// … code I showed above here

if(itemUsedOnObject == 4151 && objectId == 1) {
// double the players money or some cool shit
}[/code]

now if someone injects a fake packet… they can double their money. why? because there was no check to see if the player even had the item!!

adding this check is referred to as packet validation (I think), and it’s as simple as just checking if the player has the item before doing the action…

Read full topic

item.title: Quality Firemaking base
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:25, topic:535026”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=653826.msg4383256#msg4383256 date=1384305421]

[quote author=jummppy link=topic=653826.msg4383251#msg4383251 date=1384304939]
How doesn’t it check to see if the player has the log??? If he used the log on tinderbox??? that doesn’t make to much sense to me…
[/quote]packet spoofing? i can tell the server that i’m using admin items on each other. most server’s do things like this with donator packages, etc. and don’t check for the item. and you can easily bypass it with something like cheat engine or wpe.

[quote author=Strucker link=topic=653826.msg4383234#msg4383234 date=1384302720]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=653826.msg4383129#msg4383129 date=1384269603]
can we change the topic from ‘Quality Firemaking base’ to Unfinished, non-working Firemaking snippet

literally. nothing happens except you delete the log, and then schedule a task to walk one tile.
you don’t even check to see if the player has the item, and it only works if the player uses the log on the tinderbox.

this is nowhere near finished, nowhere near decent, and nowhere near quality.
[/quote]Go ahead and change it for me, i have no problem, and Why do you say that?
Just because you’re an experienced programmer doesn’t mean you have to go and criticize bad about others; yet this is still better than alot.
And well I’m supposed to finished it later and update the op;
However if you wanna stay in that “Pro” attitude go ahead i dont mind, just i ask you to state what could be better instead of just bombing my thread.
Thanks
[/quote]what are you on about? i never once said i’m better than you, nor did i state this sucked. (even though it does)

you post a topic, titled ‘quality firemaking base’.
however, this is neither of those.

this is nowhere near finished. it doesn’t: check for logs, check for tinderbox, alternate usage, start the fire, play the animation, play the sound, or add the experience.

you literally schedule and dispatch a task to walk one tile.

if you want this to be a ‘base’ then finish it.
if you want this to be ‘quality’ learn to take criticism.
[/quote]It’s a base for whoever that wants to not start from scratch, and im taking criticsm, thats why i asked you for an answer. thanks

But why would i check if the player has the log i mean, if he used the log its because he has it, doesn’t he?[/quote]no, not always. hence the term ‘spoofing’

Read full topic

if you want this to be ‘quality’ learn to take criticism.[/quote]It’s a base for whoever that wants to not start from scratch, and im taking criticsm, thats why i asked you for an answer. thanks

item.title: Quality Firemaking base
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:7, topic:535026”]you don’t need to document every single bit of code, just document where needed.[/quote]I think the level of documentation is perfect? Constructors and methods should always be documented, otherwise people have to read the code to work out what it does rather than just having a specification. I also found the non-method/constructor comments to be very useful as they explained things that were not immediately obvious by looking at the code.

For example, when I read this…

                                Server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(2, true) {
                                        protected void execute() {

I thought it was just dispatching a thread. But no, I read the comment and it’s scheduling a task that will be executed over 2 ticks.

Read full topic
